thread.title: Carey Lander of Camera Obscura dies of cancer at the age of 33
thread.title_full: Carey Lander of Camera Obscura dies of cancer at the age of 33

title: Carey Lander of Camera Obscura dies of cancer at the age of 33
text:
Sunday, Oct 11 2015, 21:24 BST Share on Facebook Share on Twitter Share on Google+ Musician Carey Lander, a member of Scottish indie pop band Camera Obscura , has passed away at the age of 33.Lander was diagnosed with bone cancer in 2011 and revealed that the illness had returned earlier this year. She passed away today (October 11). 
© Getty Images / Annabel Staff/Redferns Lander joined Camera Obscura in 2002 and completed four albums with the band, 2003's Underachievers Please Try Harder , 2006's Let's Get Out of This Country , 2009's My Maudlin Career and 2013's Desire Lines .She played piano and organ with the group and also provided vocals. Very sad that Carey Lander of Camera Obscura has passed. She was no age at all. — 3 Alveston Place (@3alvestonplace) October 11, 2015 Lander's Camera Obscura bandmates posted a tribute to her on Facebook, writing: "We have lost our friend and band mate, and our deepest sympathy goes out to her partner Kenny, and to all her family and friends." 
It is with the greatest sadness, that we must share the news that Carey passed away peacefully this morning after her... Posted by Camera Obscura on Sunday, 11 October 2015 Lander's JustGiving page, which she set up to raise funds for charity Sarcoma UK, is still active and her bandmates are continuing to promote the campaign on her behalf.Lander wrote on the page that she hoped the charity would be able to find a cure for the illness, saying: "It's probably too late to help me, but it would be great if we could find something in the future that means children don't have to undergo such awful treatment and have a better chance of survival."You can donate to Lander's JustGiving page here .
